title-group.article-title: Aspects of Time in Hartmann's "Der arme Heinrich"

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1988 The Board of Regents of The University of Wisconsin System

abstract.p: Hartmann's depiction of time in Der arme Heinrich provides a fresh perspective from which to assess the story. Although the plot unfolds diachronically and the number "three" as well as many adverbs of time appear (esp. dô, nû, ê), precise chronology is adumbrated. Hartmann admits scant verifiability of temporal events, manipulating the tempo of the narrative and the indicators of the passage of time. In distorting the dimension of time, he calls attention to the inadequacy of earthly calculations and joins those medieval poets using "dramatic chronology" for the purpose of exploring and exposing human attitudes. Both protagonists are required to come to terms with the temporal world and to live on in time.
